Manuel Oelmaier

Architecting Intelligence • Software Engineer

Building full-stack AI solutions with pragmatism and craftsmanship.

About me

I'm a Computer Science student at TUM specializing in Machine Learning and AI. I bridge the gap between technical innovation and real-world impact by pre-training, finetuning, and integrating LLMs into robust full-stack applications.

  • Focus: Python, TypeScript, and modern AI-driven Webstacks.
  • Interests: Intelligent Automation, Efficient LLM Architectures, and advanced Prompt Engineering.
  • Off-duty: Competitive Chess player and gym enthusiast.
Explore my Blog

Principles

Pragmatism

I approach software development with a balance of aiming high and being realistic . My priority is delivering real, tangible value within realistic timeframes. My focus is on pragmatic iteration: choosing simple solutions that just work, only adding complexity when it genuinely pays off. This means I prioritize new features and improving with user feedback, over chasing perfection.

Software Craftsmanship

With a strong foundation in computer science, I’m passionate about building reliable, scalable, and thoughtful software. I enjoy working across the stack, whether it’s crafting clean backend architectures, designing intuitive interfaces, or integrating the latest ML/AI models. As I grow as a developer, I strive to write maintainable, human-friendly code that empowers others and leads to meaningful, high-quality products.

Lifelong Learning

Technology changes fast, and staying curious is my engine for growth . I continually explore new tools, frameworks, and ideas—whether through building side projects or studying academic concepts like linear attention for transformers. For me, learning isn't a goal but a hands-on habit , ensuring I'm constantly adapting and turning new knowledge into practical, high-impact skills.

Project Showcase

Prototype: ManuChess

A small website which lets you play against a Mirror of Myself. I am currently working on training a small Neural Net with all my Chess games (tournament and online), which at the end will play like me. Coming soon!

View on GitHub
Webstack MongoDB Pytorch

LocalPythonCodingLlm

As Coursework, we fine-tuned and compared different small LLMs in their Ability to write Python Code. We made the best one publicly available via a VSC Extension, where the model can be queried locally. Since LLMs almost always need the unencrypted text,a local models solves a key privacy issue.

View on GitHub
Python Pytorch Typescript

Quiz App: Theoretical Informatics

A small website with the Collection of the Past Multiple Choice questions of public Exams, to help students prepare. Renders Formulas and Mathematical Expressions accurately.

View on GitHub
Typescript HTML CSS
